availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William E. Snoddy (Louisville, Kentucky, merchant and banker)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, merchant and banker. Kentucky native. Married to H. Adeline Snoddy. Married to Mary Margaret Owen Snoddy in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on September 28, 1854. Father of Lucy A. Snoddy, Sally C. Snoddy, Shaphly Snoddy. Clerk in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1845. Merchant in Louisville in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1850. Shoe merchant in the firm Snoddy & Bransford in Louisville from 1850 to 1855. Shoe merchant in partnership with N. Gwynn and R .P. Parrish in W.E. Snoddy & Company in Louisville from 1855 to 1860. Sold one enslaved person to Alex Norton in Louisville in January 1859. Shoe merchant in partnership with N. Gwynn, R. P. Parrish, and R.C. Snoddy in Snoddy, Gwynn & Company in Louisville from 1860 to 1864. Owned four enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Banker in Louisville in 1862. Broker in Louisville in 1863. Merchant in partnership with R. S. Howard in Snoddy & Howard in Louisville from 1863 to 1865.
